News.Title: NIIF II Sells Entire Stake in Ather Energy
News.Summary: National Investment and Infrastructure Fund II divests its complete 1.92% holding in Ather Energy Limited through block sale, reducing combined holding with India-Japan Fund to 5.88%.

News.Title: Ather Energy Plans 700 Store Expansion This Fiscal
News.Summary: Ather Energy announces aggressive retail expansion with 700 new stores planned nationwide this fiscal year, targeting significant EBITDA improvement of 1,400 BPS in Q1-Q3 FY26.

News.Title: Ather Energy Allots 4.94 Lakh Shares to ESOP Holders
News.Summary: Ather Energy's Board approved allotment of 4,94,266 equity shares to ESOP holders under the 2025 plan, increasing paid-up share capital from Rs. 38.18 crore to Rs. 38.23 crore on February 02, 2026.

News.Title: Ather Energy CEO: No Q3 Impact from China Curbs
News.Summary: Ather Energy's Co-CEO states that China's rare earth magnet export restrictions will not significantly impact the company's Q3 performance, providing reassurance to stakeholders.

News.Title: Ather Energy to Launch 'EL' Electric Vehicle Platform
News.Summary: Ather Energy Co-CEO announces upcoming launch of new 'EL' electric vehicle platform later this year, targeting expansion into North Indian markets to strengthen company's presence.

News.Title: Ather Energy Plans Auto Insurance Distribution Service
News.Summary: Ather Energy's Co-CEO announces plans for new auto insurance distribution service expected to enhance company profitability through diversified revenue streams.

News.Title: Ather Energy Grants 64,882 ESOPs to Employees
News.Summary: Ather Energy's board committee approved the grant of 64,882 Employee Stock Options under ESOP 2025 to eligible employees on February 02, 2026, with an exercise price of Rs. 1 per option.

News.Title: Ather Energy Co-CEO Warns of Industry Challenges
News.Summary: Ather Energy's Co-CEO highlights potential difficulties ahead due to rising commodity prices and reduced EV incentives affecting the electric vehicle sector.

News.Title: Ather Energy Co-CEO Highlights Operating Leverage Strategy
News.Summary: Ather Energy's Co-CEO emphasizes that operating leverage is the key factor for reducing the company's losses, indicating a strategic focus on operational efficiency improvements.

News.Title: Ather Energy Sets Up Hong Kong Unit for Procurement
News.Summary: Ather Energy establishes new Hong Kong subsidiary to strengthen procurement operations and enhance supply chain management capabilities for its electric vehicle business.

News.Title: Ather Energy Q3 Loss Narrows, Revenue Jumps 49.6%
News.Summary: Electric vehicle manufacturer Ather Energy reported a significant reduction in net loss to ₹846 million in Q3 from ₹1.97 billion year-over-year, while revenue surged 49.6% to ₹9.5 billion.

News.Title: Ather Energy Q3FY26 Earnings Call Set for Feb 2
News.Summary: Ather Energy Limited announces earnings conference call scheduled for February 02, 2026 at 05:30 PM IST to discuss Q3FY26 financial results with analysts and investors.

News.Title: Ather Energy Appoints Vivek Anand as Director
News.Summary: Ather Energy Limited successfully completed postal ballot voting for appointing Mr. Vivek Anand as Non-Executive Non-Independent Director. The resolution passed with 99.84% approval from shareholders with 81.12% voter participation.

News.Title: Ather Energy Expands Access to 5000+ Fast Chargers
News.Summary: Ather Energy announces riders now have access to 5000+ two-wheeler fast chargers across 395+ cities in India, including 3675+ operated by Ather and 1400+ through LECCS partners.

News.Title: Ather Energy Appoints Surabhi Loshali as CHRO
News.Summary: Ather Energy Limited announces appointment of Ms. Surabhi Loshali as Chief Human Resources Officer effective January 05, 2026. She brings over 20 years of HR leadership experience across multiple industries.

News.Title: Ather Energy Plans Scooter Price Hike Up To ₹3,000
News.Summary: Electric vehicle manufacturer Ather Energy announces plans to increase scooter prices by up to ₹3,000.00 starting January, reflecting ongoing market adjustments in the EV sector.

News.Title: Ather Energy Board Approves Wholly Owned Insurance Subsidiary
News.Summary: Ather Energy's board approved incorporation of wholly owned subsidiary for insurance corporate agent business with up to ₹8 crores initial investment on December 19, 2025.

News.Title: Ather Energy Grants 24,231 Employee Stock Options Under ESOP 2025 Plan
News.Summary: Ather Energy's Nomination and Remuneration Committee approved the grant of 24,231 Employee Stock Options under the Ather Energy ESOP 2025 plan to eligible employees on November 28, 2025. Each vested option allows employees to apply for one equity share with face value of Rs. 1, exercisable within five years from the vesting date.

News.Title: Ather Energy Allots 7.69 Lakh Equity Shares Under ESOP Plan
News.Summary: Ather Energy's Board allotted 7,69,375 equity shares of Rs. 1 face value each to eligible ESOP holders who exercised their stock options under the Ather Energy ESOP 2025 Plan. The company's paid-up share capital increased from Rs. 38,06,37,934 to Rs. 38,14,07,309, with the new shares ranking pari-passu with existing equity shares.

News.Title: Ather Energy Launches Rizta Electric Scooter in Sri Lanka with 40 Experience Centers
News.Summary: Ather Energy launched its Rizta electric scooter in Sri Lanka at the Colombo Motor Show, expanding its international product offerings. The company established 40 experience centers across the country to support its market entry and customer engagement strategy.

News.Title: Ather Energy Reports Strong Q2 FY2026 Performance with 67% Volume Growth and Market Share Gains
News.Summary: Ather Energy achieved 66,000 unit sales in Q2 FY2026, marking 67% year-on-year growth with total income reaching INR 940 crores and market share improving to 17.4%. The company expanded to 524 stores across India while reducing EBITDA losses to below 10% for the first time, despite facing rare earth supply chain challenges that impacted subsidy filings.

News.Title: NIIF II Sells 2.75% Stake in Ather Energy Through Block Deal
News.Summary: National Investment and Infrastructure Fund II sold 1,04,44,294 shares of Ather Energy Limited representing 2.75% of the company's total share capital through an on-market block sale on November 13, 2025. The transaction reduced NIIF II's holding in the electric vehicle company from 4.68% to 1.93%, while the combined holding of NIIF II and its PAC India-Japan Fund decreased from 10.58% to 7.84%.

News.Title: Ather Energy Appoints Vivek Anand as Non-Executive Director
News.Summary: Ather Energy Limited has appointed Mr. Vivek Anand as an Additional Director (Non-Executive Director) effective November 10, 2025. The appointment was approved by the Board of Directors based on the recommendation of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee. Anand is a finance professional with over three decades of experience across FMCG, Telecom, Paints, Consumer Healthcare and Real Estate sectors. He joined Hero MotoCorp in March 2024 to lead the finance function and has previously worked with companies including Hindustan Unilever Limited, Unilever Singapore, Unilever Bangladesh, Telenor, GSK and DLF. As Group Chief Financial Officer at DLF Ltd, he helped drive the company to an all-time high market cap of $27 billion. He also participated in India's largest business divestment in the consumer sector valued at $4 billion during his tenure at GSK Healthcare. Anand is a Chartered Accountant with expertise in Finance, Treasury, Mergers & Acquisitions, Corporate Planning, Investor Relations, Tax Planning, Risk Management and Information Technology. He is not related to any existing Director of the company and is not debarred from holding directorship.

News.Title: Ather Energy Reports 67% YoY Unit Sales Growth and Plans Network Expansion to 700 Touchpoints
News.Summary: Ather Energy achieved 67% year-over-year growth in unit sales, reaching 66,000 units and capturing 17.4% market share. The company's EBITDA margins improved by 1,100 basis points year-over-year through scale and cost optimization efforts. Ather gained 14.6% market share in Middle India and plans to expand its network to 700 touchpoints by FY26. The company is positioning itself for leadership in the premium electric scooter segment with guidance for aggressive growth.

News.Title: Ather Energy Reports No Deviations in IPO Fund Utilization for Q2 2025
News.Summary: Ather Energy Limited submitted its monitoring agency report for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, showing no deviations from the stated objectives of its Rs. 2,626 crore IPO. The company utilized Rs. 334.98 crore during the quarter across various objectives including capital expenditure for E2W factory establishment (Rs. 55.67 crore), research and development (Rs. 110.46 crore), marketing initiatives (Rs. 31.55 crore), and general corporate purposes (Rs. 28.05 crore). The company also completed repayment of certain borrowings totaling Rs. 40 crore. Factory 3.0 construction began in September 2025 after receiving environmental clearance, shifting the production commencement timeline from July 2026 to October 2026, though the overall completion timeline of March 2027 remains unchanged. Unutilized proceeds of Rs. 1,933.26 crore are deployed in fixed deposits with Axis Bank and Kotak Bank earning returns of 7.05% and 6.81% respectively. CARE Ratings Limited served as the monitoring agency and confirmed no conflicts of interest in their assessment.

News.Title: Ather Energy Reports Narrowed Net Loss and Strong Revenue Growth in Q2
News.Summary: Ather Energy reported a net loss of 1.54 billion rupees in Q2, an improvement from the 1.97 billion rupees loss in the same period last year. The electric vehicle company's revenue increased significantly to 8.99 billion rupees compared to 5.84 billion rupees in the previous year's corresponding quarter, representing substantial year-over-year growth.

News.Title: Internet Fund III Pte Ltd Sells Entire 5.09% Stake in Ather Energy
News.Summary: Internet Fund III Pte Ltd has sold its complete shareholding in Ather Energy Limited through open market transactions. The fund disposed of 1,93,60,832 shares, representing 5.09% of the total share capital and 4.97% of the diluted share capital, on November 6, 2025. Following this transaction, Internet Fund III's holding in Ather Energy has reduced to zero. The fund is associated with Tiger Global Management LLC and made the disclosure under SEBI takeover regulations. Ather Energy's total equity share capital stands at 38,03,24,241 shares, while the diluted share capital is 38,98,39,093 shares.

News.Title: Ather Energy Shares Drop 11% as Lock-In Period Ends, Freeing ₹10,800 Crore Worth of Equity
News.Summary: Ather Energy shares declined 11% as the company's six-month shareholder lock-in period expired, making 16.23 crore shares available for trading. These shares represent 44% of the company's outstanding equity and are valued at ₹10,800 crore based on Tuesday's closing price. The end of the lock-in period makes shares eligible for trading but does not guarantee they will be sold. Promoter shareholding decreased to 41.22% in September from 42.09% in June. Major institutional investors include mutual funds with 12.4% stake, NIIF with 4.67%, and India Japan Fund with 5.67%. Retail shareholders hold 4.63% of the company. Despite the day's decline, shares recovered partially to trade 6.4% lower at ₹624.3, and the stock has gained 106% year-to-date.

News.Title: Ather Energy Schedules Q2 FY26 Earnings Conference Call for November 11, 2025
News.Summary: Ather Energy Limited has announced an earnings conference call with analysts and investors scheduled for Tuesday, November 11, 2025 at 10:00 AM IST to discuss Q2 FY26 results. The call follows a Board of Directors meeting planned for November 10, 2025. The conference call will feature Executive Director and CEO Tarun Sanjay Mehta and Chief Financial Officer Sohil Dilipkumar Parekh as speakers. Multiple dial-in numbers have been provided for participants from different regions including India, Singapore, UK, Hong Kong, and USA. The company has noted that the schedule is subject to change due to business exigencies.

News.Title: Ather Energy Allots 3.13 Lakh Equity Shares Under ESOP Plan
News.Summary: Ather Energy Limited allotted 313,693 equity shares with a face value of Rs. 1 each to eligible ESOP holders who exercised their stock options under the Ather Energy ESOP 2025 Plan. The allotment was approved through a circular resolution by the Board of Directors. Following this allotment, the company's paid-up share capital increased from Rs. 38.03 crore to Rs. 38.06 crore, with the total number of equity shares rising from 38,03,24,241 to 38,06,37,934. The newly allotted shares will have equal rights with existing equity shares.

News.Title: China's Lithium Export Controls Impact Indian EV Makers Ather Energy and Ola Electric Differently
News.Summary: China imposed export controls on lithium battery materials and manufacturing equipment starting November 8, affecting global EV supply chains including Indian electric two-wheeler manufacturers. The regulations target high-energy lithium-ion batteries with energy densities of 300 Wh/kg or higher, key cathode and anode materials, and critical manufacturing machinery. Ather Energy shares gained 16% in the past month and 85% over three months, reaching Rs 634.5. The company sources lithium-ion cells from China but is reducing dependence through partnerships with Amara Raja Energy & Mobility for battery localization. Analysts view Ather's technical indicators as strong, with the stock trading above its 20-day SMA near 580-585 zone. Ola Electric shares declined 13% over the past month to Rs 52.58 and are down 41% over the past year. Despite producing 4680 lithium-ion cells at its Tamil Nadu Gigafactory and developing rare earth-free ferrite motors, Ola remains exposed to Chinese component dependencies. Technical analysts see bearish momentum for Ola Electric, recommending caution with critical support at Rs 48. Both companies face supply chain disruptions and potential cost pressures, though Ather's localization efforts and stronger technical position may provide better near-term resilience.

News.Title: Ather Energy Reaches 500,000 Electric Scooter Production Milestone, Plans Maharashtra Factory Expansion
News.Summary: Ather Energy Ltd has achieved a production milestone of 500,000 electric scooters with the launch of its RIZTA model. The company is establishing Factory 3.0 in Maharashtra, which is expected to increase annual production capacity to 1.42 million units.

News.Title: Ather Energy Defers Rs 262.50 Million in PM E-DRIVE Claims Due to China's Rare Earth Magnet Export Ban
News.Summary: Ather Energy Limited announced it will defer demand incentive claims worth Rs. 262.50 million under the PM E-DRIVE scheme for up to 52,500 vehicles. The deferral stems from supply chain disruptions caused by China's export ban on certain heavy rare earth magnets, forcing the company's motor suppliers to make temporary adjustments that deviate from Phased Manufacturing Program guidelines for traction motor manufacturing. The company is in discussions with the Ministry of Heavy Industries seeking temporary exemption from domestic fitment requirements for magnets. Ather has developed a Heavy Rare Earth Free motor as an alternative solution and received type approval from ARAI, with PM E-DRIVE eligibility certificates already being issued for these motors across different models.

News.Title: Ather Energy Shareholders Approve Re-appointment of Pankaj Sood as Non-executive Director
News.Summary: Shareholders of Ather Energy Limited approved the re-appointment of Mr. Pankaj Sood as Non-executive Director at the 12th Annual General Meeting held on September 17, 2025. Sood, who has been associated with the company since November 11, 2022, holds degrees from IIT Kharagpur and IIM Kolkata. He brings over 25 years of experience in finance, advisory and capital markets, having previously worked with Kotak Mahindra Capital Company Limited, Ernst & Young and SBI Capital Markets. He is employed by GIC in the Global Leadership Group. His office shall be liable to retire by rotation, and he is not related to any other Director of the company.

News.Title: Ather Energy Surges 66% While Ola Electric Falls 22% Since IPO Debuts
News.Summary: Ather Energy shares have gained 66.4% from their listing price of Rs 326.05 to Rs 542.55, while Ola Electric has declined 22.5% from its IPO price of Rs 76 to Rs 58.90. Despite lower share price, Ola maintains larger market cap at Rs 25,181 crore versus Ather's Rs 20,272 crore. Ather reported narrowed net loss of Rs 178 crore with 79% revenue growth to Rs 645 crore and improved EBITDA margin to 16%. Ola posted wider net loss of Rs 428 crore with revenue halving to Rs 828 crore and EBITDA margin worsening to -28.6%. Analysts note Ather's strong uptrend with technical targets of Rs 560-575, while Ola faces potential decline to Rs 55. Ola secured PLI certification for Gen-3 scooters providing policy advantages, while Ather's CEO has called for auto-PLI framework review. Both companies compete in India's electric two-wheeler market with different positioning strategies.

News.Title: Ather Energy Shares Rise 5% Following New Electric Scooter Platform Launch
News.Summary: Ather Energy's share price increased 5.45% to Rs 474.70, later settling 3.17% higher at Rs 464.40. The surge followed the company's launch of a new electric scooter platform called EL at the Ather Community Day in Bengaluru. Co-founder Tarun Mehta stated that achieving 20% market share is possible in the near term. The new EL platform reduces e-scooter parts to 15 at the vehicle level, making assembly 15% faster and production 15% cheaper. The first product from this platform is expected next year. Ather currently holds 17% of the domestic electric two-wheeler market, double from the previous year's April-June quarter. The stock has gained 53.62% over 12 months, with trading volume at 6.5 times the 30-day average. Four analysts maintain 'buy' ratings with an average 12-month price target implying 0.4% downside.

News.Title: Ather Energy Plans 700 Stores by FY26, Targets 20% EV Scooter Market Share
News.Summary: Ather Energy, currently the second-largest player in India's EV scooter market, announced aggressive expansion plans including growing from 200 outlets to 700 stores by FY26. CEO Tarun Mehta outlined the company's strategy to compete on product quality rather than discounts, maintaining focus on premium experiences above ₹1 lakh price point. The company unveiled its new EL platform at Ather Community Day, enabling launch of wider scooter variants including commuter, maxi and sportier models. Ather also showcased Redux, a scooter-motorcycle crossover concept for future electric motorcycle segment entry. The company aims for 20% market share in India's EV scooter market by FY26. Mehta expressed disappointment over not qualifying for the government's Production-Linked Incentive scheme, citing startup-unfriendly definitions that limit their ability to launch lower-cost products.

News.Title: Ather Energy CEO Criticizes India's PLI Policy as 'Not Startup-Friendly'
News.Summary: Ather Energy co-founder and CEO Tarun Mehta criticized India's Production-Linked Incentive (PLI) policy, calling it unfriendly to startups. Speaking at Ather's Community Day 2025 in Bengaluru, Mehta argued that the policy shuts out startups like Ather from applying despite their role in electric mobility disruption. He stated that Ather has invested heavily in EV R&D and built large infrastructure but doesn't qualify for PLI benefits. Mehta claimed the framework favors larger incumbents who may lack serious EV commitments and called for policy corrections. He noted that PLI access could enable Ather to launch lower-priced products and compete in the mass-market segment. Ather has doubled its market share to nearly 17% in August and leads the EV market across South India and Gujarat. The company unveiled its new EL platform at the event.

News.Title: Ather Energy Launches 'Battery As A Service' Initiative to Boost EV Adoption
News.Summary: Ather Energy has launched a 'Battery As A Service' offering along with new plans aimed at increasing electric vehicle adoption in India. The company is introducing this service model as part of its strategy to expand EV accessibility in the Indian market.

News.Title: Ather Energy Reports Strong Q1 FY26 Results with 100% Volume Growth and Improved Margins
News.Summary: Ather Energy delivered robust quarterly results with units sold reaching 46,000, up 100% year-on-year. Total income grew 83% to INR 672 crores while adjusted gross margins improved to 23%, marking a 700 basis points improvement even excluding government incentives. EBITDA losses narrowed significantly from -33% to -16%. The company expanded its retail network by 95 stores, reaching 446 total stores, and achieved market leadership in South India with 22.8% market share. Non-vehicle revenues contributed 12% to total revenue through accessories, warranty programs, and software. The company added 400 charging points, reaching 4,000 total charging infrastructure points. Management highlighted potential short-term impact from rare earth magnet supply issues affecting approximately one week of production in the current quarter. Ather plans to unveil its new EL platform and Ather Stack 7 software at its Community Day event on August 30, 2025.

News.Title: Ather Energy Launches New 450S Electric Scooter at ₹145,999 in Bengaluru
News.Summary: Ather Energy has launched its new 450S electric scooter model in Bengaluru. The vehicle features a 161 km range and is equipped with a 3.7 KWh battery. The 450S is priced at ₹145,999.

News.Title: Ather Energy Schedules Q1FY26 Earnings Conference Call for August 4, 2025
News.Summary: Ather Energy Limited has scheduled an earnings conference call with analysts and investors on August 4, 2025 at 4:30 PM IST to discuss Q1FY26 updates. The call follows the company's Board of Directors meeting scheduled for the same day. The earnings conference will be led by Executive Director & CEO Tarun Sanjay Mehta and Chief Financial Officer Sohil Dilipkumar Parekh. Participants can join through pre-registration or dial-in numbers provided for various international locations including Singapore, UK, Hong Kong, and USA.

News.Title: Ather Energy Narrows Gap with Ola Electric to Just 525 Units in July E2W Sales
News.Summary: Ather Energy sold 13,187 electric scooters in July 2025, achieving a 16.5% market share and closing the gap with Ola Electric to just 525 units. Ola Electric sold 13,712 units with a 17.2% market share. Both companies trail behind TVS Motor (22% share) and Bajaj Auto (21.1% share) in the electric two-wheeler market. The overall E2W market grew 21.6% in July compared to June. This marks a significant shift from July 2024, when Ola held 39% market share with 41,803 units sold, while Ather had 9% share with 10,218 units. Ather's growth is driven by its Rizta scooter, launched less than a year ago, which now accounts for 60% of monthly sales and has crossed 100,000 units. The Rizta is priced between ₹99,999 and ₹1,14,500. Ather operated 351 retail centers as of March 2025 and plans to expand to 700 outlets by the end of FY26. Ola Electric has shifted focus toward profitability, resulting in reduced monthly sales and allowing competitors to gain market share.

News.Title: DPIIT Partners With Ather Energy To Support EV Manufacturing Startups
News.Summary: The Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade signed a Memorandum of Understanding with electric vehicle maker Ather Energy to create opportunities for startups in the EV and manufacturing sectors. The partnership will provide strategic mentorship for deep-tech startups and infrastructure support for companies in the EV value chain. DPIIT Joint Secretary Sanjiv Singh stated the collaboration aims to enable startups to contribute to EV manufacturing, battery innovation, and clean energy solutions.

News.Title: Ather Energy Receives Favorable Tax Order, Avoids ₹72.8 Crore Demand
News.Summary: Ather Energy Limited received an order from the Tamil Nadu State Tax Authority dropping proceedings related to a show cause notice for alleged excess input tax credit. The order nullifies a potential demand of INR 72.8 million (₹7.28 Crore) plus interest and penalties, resulting in no financial impact on the company. The show cause notice dated March 18, 2025, alleged excess input tax credit availed for March 2024, with total proposed demand including interest and penalty of INR 11.8 million and INR 7.3 million respectively. The Assistant Commissioner's order dated July 18, 2025, dropped all proceedings against the notice.

News.Title: Ather Energy Launches Rizta S Electric Scooter
News.Summary: Ather Energy has introduced a new electric scooter model called Rizta S. The scooter features a 3.7KWh battery and offers an IDC (Indian Driving Cycle) range of 159 kilometers.

News.Title: Ather Energy: New EV Platform and Fast Chargers to Debut at Community Day 2025
News.Summary: Ather Energy will unveil its new EL platform for electric scooters, concept vehicles, next-generation Grid fast chargers, and AtherStack 7.0 software update at Community Day 2025 in August. The event focuses on 'Technology that works like magic' and aims to expand Ather's product lineup for domestic and international markets.

News.Title: Ather Energy Plans to Double Retail Network with 700 Experience Centers
News.Summary: Ather Energy aims to expand its retail presence in India by doubling its network. The company plans to establish 700 Experience Centers across the country. This expansion strategy suggests Ather Energy is focusing on increasing its market reach and customer accessibility.

News.Title: Ather Energy's Ather Rizta Achieves 100,000 Retail Sales Milestone
News.Summary: Ather Energy has announced that its Ather Rizta model has surpassed 100,000 units in retail sales. This milestone represents a significant achievement for the company in the electric vehicle market.

News.Title: Ather Energy: EV Maker Targets 20% Market Share in FY26
News.Summary: Ather Energy aims to increase its market share to 20% in FY26, up from 13.3% in Q4 FY25. The growth strategy focuses on expanding distribution networks and maintaining premium product offerings. The company reported a 29% revenue increase in Q4FY25 with narrowing losses. Ather plans to shift to a more cost-efficient LFP battery platform and has expanded its store network by 80 in Q4 alone.
